info.name: Firefox Search Bar Show Engine Names (Firefox 43+)
info.description:
Firefox 57 or Stylish 3.0 users: Please go to https://www.jeffersonscher.com/gm/search-bar-names.html to install.
Stylish 2.x users: SCROLL DOWN AND USE "ADVANCED STYLE SETTINGS" BEFORE INSTALLATION.

If you have multiple search engine plugins for the same site, having only an icon may be annoying. This style shows a more classic list-style display. Developed and tested on Firefox 43.

To try different options after you install the style, reload the page until you get a green Update button, then you can choose a different option and update to it.
info.additionalInfo: Catch the movie: Firefox Old Search Bar vs. Restyled New Bar. Additional images: {Vertical spacing options - difference} • {Turn optional sections of the panel on and off} • {Overlay default search engine name on search bar} If you have over 20 search plugins showing in the drop-down, consider using the two-column list style (last item on the drop-down for #1). Change Log: 2019-10-24 Fixes for two-column display 2019-09-03 Add Firefox 69 compatibility 2018-08-02 Tweak suggestion area height for Firefox 61 2017-12-03 Color schemes to improve text contrast on light theme and better match dark theme 2017-08-08 Fix selectors to avoid restyling the bottom of the address bar drop-down (Fx55) 2016-02-03 Tweak text position, add two-column option, space for 5 suggestions 2015-12-28 Added color theming options 2015-12-27 Override the green + on the icon if you aren't going to show the Add... bar 2015-12-25 Tweaked Search Bar tooltips to avoid overflowing the available space 2015-12-24 Added option for search box tooltip (e.g., Search using DuckDuckGo) 2015-12-24 Tweak sizes and positions, added install-time options for hiding various parts 2015-12-21 Initial version (+ minor modification to shorten row heights)
